comment: A variable is nonfree in a formula if and only if it is nonfree in its negation. Intuitionistically, the forward implication is true, and ` F// x -. -. ph -> F// x -. ph ` , so a good definition of nonfreeness would be the conjunction ` F// x ph /\ F// x -. ph ` . Maybe adopt it also here for uniformity? See ~ nfnt . (Contributed by BJ, 28-Jul-2023.)
